fields.summary: Restore the backup from the upgraded test instance to the Cloud instance

fields.description:
As explained in https://blogs.oracle.com/jonthecollector/entry/the_unspoken_gc_times, garbage collection involves pauses that are not normally logged. These pauses might cause cluster heartbeat to time out (no reply for 30 seconds from a node).

Add the -XX:+PrintGCApplicationStoppedTime JVM parameter to the CATALINA_OPTS in setenv.sh and setenv.bat.
fields.summary: Log complete GC pause times

fields.description:

1. Open same confluence page in two browser tabs
2. Add comment containing code macro in first tab
3. Do a quick reload in second tab
4. There is no code in loaded comment, just an empty container

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36200].
  {panel}

When editing a page confluence overrides my browsers inbuilt search (control f) ability, however the implementation does not work as expected in that clicking 'next' after entering a search term does not take my browser to the occurrence of the term. 
Steps to reproduce:
1. go to create a confluence page 
2. on the create page screen enter text that fills your screen & then put the text 'findme' just on the next line so that it is not visible when you scroll up to the top of the page
3. then search for 'findme' it is highlighted.
4. observe that you are not taken to the 'findme' highlighted match.
fields.summary: Confluence search/find tool does not work as expected

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36199].
  {panel}

I have a request for ability to require thread titles on comments, and auto-expand them then so that the users will be more tempted to simply reply to the thread than create new threads.

Example:
# Create thread with title *Concern Over Stability*
# Thread body: "Could you please review this page and elaborate how this feature will enhance the supportability of our software."
# Then users will reply to this thread and not just create a new comment.
fields.summary: Option to require thread title in comment threads

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36196].
  {panel}

Unless I miss something, there is still no sort capability for Confluence REST content.

According to [example|https://developer.atlassian.com/display/CONFDEV/Confluence+REST+API+Examples#ConfluenceRESTAPIExamples-Findblogposts], [API|https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/REST/latest/#d3e450] and [forum|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/306946/sort-order-in-rest-api-in-confluence-5.5], there is no sort feature at all.  

The consequence of this is that when listing content it comes out oldest first, needing all history ever to be gone through in order to get to the most recent, which would be used for any kind of remote 'recent' view, which is what we want to do, (eg most recent 50 blog posts).

This improvement is for a sort capability, by field, and ascending /descending.  The default field could easily by the contentId, sort order default to ASC to deliver current output, surely an afternoons work :) , enabling api to set sortOrder=DESC would surely be useful in a wider context?

If this is already logged somewhere (surely! but I couldn't find it), please link when marking as a duplicate.
fields.summary: Rest API /content/ needs sort order

fields.description:
I created an application link between my Confluence and JIRA instance and included JIRA's activity stream gadget as an external gadget. When I add the gadget on a Confluence page the JIRA data is correctly shown. However, the point to the following url:

http://confluence.company.com/browse/JIRA-1

instead of:

http://jira.company.com/browse/JIRA-1

This makes it impossible for users to directly navigate to the correct JIRA ticket. I seems that Confluence takes its own base url to create the full JIRA ticket url, instead of the one from JIRA, http://jira.company.com.

As a test I tried to change the base url from Confluence and indeed this also affected the jira issues links.

Maybe this issue is fixed in a later version, but could you provide me with a workaround for now?

Kind regards,
Benji
fields.summary: JIRA Activity Stream gadget does not point to the correct JIRA urls

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36190].
  {panel}

A space where to document a JIRA scheme.

A missing feature of JIRA is the ability to document the usage of screens and fields, workflows and so on for the benefit of the End User.
In would be nice to a have a very special confluence space, namely «Jira Help Space», where Jira admins can document all the elements above mentioned. 
The Space would be populated automatically by all the «documentable» entities of the JIRA scheme. At the same time, every element of the JIRA that has been provided with an help, would be enabled to show the documentation.
It would be so possible to:
- Document screens
- Document fields (possibily on screens)
- Document states (possibly on workflows)
- Document workflows (statuses, transitions, conditions, validations error messages…)
and so on… with an integrated help on line in Jira End User UI

Duplicated from https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-41653… dubts on pertinence :)
fields.summary: Jira Help Space

This page contains issue after upgrade

You should see the page like below :

fields.description:
When importing a Space Export from Cloud (v 5.6-OD-39-039 ) it fails with the following error message:
{quote}
Import failed. Check your server logs for more information. com.atlassian.confluence.importexport.ImportExportException: Unable to complete import: Error while importing backup: not-null property references a null or transient value: com.atlassian.confluence.pages.Attachment.contentType
{quote}

A Space Export from Server version can be imported but not recent Confluence Cloud Space Exports.

This is caused by recent changes in the DB structure of Cloud Confluence version.
It will be available when the next Confluence Server version 5.7 with the same database changes is released.

NB: If you are migrating your instance from Cloud to Server, there is a different process to follow - you will need to download a special installation to migrate your site. The full process is outlined [here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/DOC/Migrating+from+Confluence+Cloud+to+Confluence+Server].
fields.summary: Space imports from latest Cloud fail on Server

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36165].
  {panel}

SSLv3 is an old protocol and has been superseded by TLSv1.0, TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2. TLSv1.0 was first defined in January 1999 and java 6 supports and uses it as the default client version in TLS handshake.

SSLv3 is old and limits the ciphers that can be used. SSLv3 is also vulnerable to POODLE. We should disable SSLv3 by default and provide a system property to re-enable it.

Note: Java 7 supports TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 in client mode but defaults to using TLSv1 in the TLS handshake. We should use TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 in client mode TLS in java 7 as well. Java 8 enables TLSv1.1 and TLSv1.2 in client mode(in addition to SSLv3 and TLSv1) and uses TLSv1.2 by default in TLS handshake.

Workaround:
Upgrade to Oracle Java 7 update 76 (or higher) or Java 8 update 31(or higher) as these versions disable SSLv3.
Alternatively, set jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms in <JRE_HOME>/lib/security/java.security to include SSLv3 as per the following example:
{code}
# Example:
#   jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms=MD5, SSLv3, DSA, RSA keySize < 2048
jdk.tls.disabledAlgorithms=SSLv3
{code}
fields.summary: Disable SSLv3 in outgoing HTTPS connections from Confluence

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36157].
  {panel}

I've recently discovered that the wiki doesn't apply images effects (such as "taped", "drop shadow" etc.) when images are too large. I can't find anywhere exactly _what_ those dimensions are, but my bigger problem is that the system provides no feedback whatsoever when this happens. When you apply image effects to a large photo, it lets you do it just fine, but it doesn't display the effect. This leads to a lot of confusion for the user--why isn't it working? Is it a problem with my computer? The image? The page?

If it were me, I would improve it as follows:

*Improve Documentation*
# Update the documentation to explain the outer limits of when image effects will be applied
# When a user applies an effect to an image that is too large, provide feedback to the effect of "This image is too large for effects to be applied. Please resize to be less than ____px by _____px if you would like to display image effects."

*Make the constraints larger*
Images that are 1600px by 500px should work, but it doesn't. These constraints should be more lenient. Why is there a limit at all? Is it a memory issue (like this [knowledge base|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/CONFKB/Image+effects+are+not+displayed+in+Confluence+5.5+or+later] article implies), or is there another reason?

*To recreate the problem...*
* Upload an image to the wiki that's bigger than 1599 by 449 pixels. 
* Click on the image, and select "Properties" from the pop-up menu
* Click any of the image effects that appear in the window
* Save the changes, and observe that the image doesn't look any different.
* Wish there was feedback to explain why the effect wasn't applied
fields.summary: Provide feedback when images are too large to apply image effects.

fields.description:
h3. Summary
On a Labelled Content page, browsing for next page will result in duplicated labels.

h3. Steps to reproduce:
# Have a space that has contain many pages with the same label
# Go to Popular Label page by either:
#* Browse > Labels on Documentation theme
#* Access using "Popular Labels" macro
#* Access the Labelled Content page directly using the URL: http://<Confluence Base URL>/labels/listlabels-alphaview.action?key=<SPACEKEY>
# Choose the label that labels many pages in this space
# the "Labeled Content" page show up with a list of pages that has the same label. Below is an example of the label "decisions"
!Capture.PNG|thumbnail!
# Note that the URL is currently:
{code}
http://http://<Confluence Base URL>//label/<SPACEKEY>/<Label chosen>
{code}
# Click Next >> to view the next page

h3. Expected Results
Everything that's displayed in the page is still the same except that the next page is shown.

h3. Actual Results
The label now is duplicated and both of them has become "-decisions" "-decisions"
!Capture1.PNG|thumbnail!

h3. Further observations
For an example of Confluence that has a base URL of http://localhost:15910/confluence, label named "decisions" with label ID of 1015809

Note that the URL changes to the following after clicking "next" from the first page:
{code}
http://localhost:15910/confluence/label/5910/decisions?ids=1015809&startIndex=10
{code}

If we press the Next button even further, URL changes into the following:
{code}
http://localhost:15910/confluence/label/5910/decisions?ids=1015809&ids=1015809&startIndex=20
{code}
Note that the "ids=1015809" is duplicated

 
h3. Notes
# Using the macro "Labels List" will also give the same behavior
# View attached screencast for more information
fields.summary: Label duplicates with - sign with every click of Next or Previous page on "Labelled Content" page due to Label-related Macros

fields.description:
h6. Steps to replicate
# Download Confluence 5.5.2.
# Create an user "test".
# Create a group "testing".
# Add the user "test" into  group "testing".
# Create a space name "Permission".
# Restrict the space to group "testing".
# Access Confluence as user "Test".
# Access the page name "Permission" and watch the page.
# Now access Confluence as Confluence Admin.
# Restrict the space "Permission" only to confluence admin and remove "testing" group from the permission.



h6. Observed Behavior
The user test still receiving notification in Workbox if any changes made in the space "permission".

h6. Expected Behavior
The user "Test" should not receive any notification from space "Permission" although they are watching the space.


h6. Workaround
Confluence administrator need to remove the user from the space watch list with the following steps:
# Navigate to the space which sending the notification. 
# Click on "Watch" and then click on manage watchers
# Check if the user name is in the list, if yes please remove him from that list.
fields.summary: User receiving notification from a restricted space
Session ID Directions

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36149].
  {panel}

h3. ***Improvement Request***
Allow users some way of choosing what is displayed in the Google Docs list macro.

h3. ***Use Case***
Currently, it appears that if you have more than 100 documents in Google Docs you can only see the first 100 that Google returns. If a company is using Google Docs (as ours is), it does not take long to exceed this limit. Only supporting 100 documents makes this feature unusable for any reasonably sized company that is using Google Docs and Google integration.

If you query to narrow the list, it still only searches the first 100 documents.

The request is to support Google Docs -- with all documents either through query or browsing. Currently it is unusable.
fields.summary: Google docs integration to include more than 100 total documents
Add an Allow in robots.txt for adding Team Calendars calendars to Google Calendars
Notify customers who export Confluence OnDemand that they will need to deploy a special version if they want to self-host

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36146].
  {panel}

Currently, OnDemand customers have no ability to control page breaks to create a clean pdf export.  This is critical when creating client-facing documentation as often you need to ensure content and tables or content and image are kept together. Or, you want to minimize orphan or widowed content - makes no sense to have a section header at the end of a page and the content start the next. 
There are hacks you can do, but they are not supported by Atlassian. 
Atlassian recommends using a Page Break user macro; however, OnDemand customers do not have the ability to add user macros nor can they add the HTML macro which would allow them to insert a page break using html. 
The easiest option is to provide the Page Break macro out of the box for OnDemand users.
fields.summary: Provide ability for OnDemand users to insert page breaks to have a clean pdf export
Ability to customise space layout

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36144].
  {panel}

When logged in to an OnDemand account, JIRA tabs have a favicon but Confluence tabs do not making them difficult to locate in my tab bar.

In the attached screenshot there are three full tabs shown. From left to right:
1) Gmail
2) Confluence
3) JIRA
fields.summary: Confluence Favicon Missing in Atlassian OnDemand

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36143].
  {panel}

Plugin and customisation options in Confluence OnDemand are deliberately constrained in order to provide a stable and scalable software-as-a-service solution. There are also good reasons to stick with the default UI, because users benefit from Atlassian's ongoing investment in the Confluence user experience.

However, many customers would like the ability to brand their Confluence OnDemand instance beyond the current colour and space logo options.

A happy medium between the two might be to provide some additional header and footer configuration options:

1. Allow a background image in the header and allow the header to grow up to an additional 40px in height, if desired (see attached example). This would make the header the same height as when the "temporary access to administrative functions" warning is displayed.
2. Allow a custom footer, implemented in a similar fashion to the site welcome message that would appear before the current footer (but not replace it). This could be used to create a "fat footer" for navigation or links to site terms and conditions etc.

This custom header would require some modification to the current navigation bar design:
- include a text only option instead of just logo + text or logo. Ideally the 'home' link text could be defined separately to the Site Title. This is because the customer's logo could instead be included in the background image.
- change the dimensions of the link hover behaviour so that the background is the same size as the 'Create' button.
fields.summary: Custom header and footer in Confluence OnDemand
Allow RSS Feed Macro in Confluence Cloud
Select a subset of Google documents to display with the Google Document List macro
Add capability to search Google Docs from with OnDemand (JIRA and Confluence)
Support for displaying drawings created with Google's Drawing tool in wiki
Add support for auto detection of GDOCS when trying to link a document

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36137].
  {panel}

When I create wiki pages, I see two different behaviors for html links.

1) A link added directly will +be underlined+.
2) A link cut and pasted from my previous wiki (Redmine), the link will not be underlined.

OnDemand offers no way to manage all link styles. I'd like to control this behavior with a setting in the theme, or to be able to customize my CSS.
fields.summary: Allow customized CSS in Confluence OnDemand
Add Objective-C to CodeBlock macro
Alow users to import OnDemand Confluence backups generated via Backup Manager back to Confluence OnDemand.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36134].
  {panel}

Currently, OnDemand customers have no ability to enhance their content used for client facing documentation with either TOCs,notes, or attachments that should not be printed when a PDF export is created.  Having this minimizes having to break up content into separate pages, thus disrupting the flow of the information or making it confusing; it also requires more work to be done by the technical writer to create these separate pages and then making the appropriate references. 

Being able to have a no print around a set of attachments allows the user to be able to see what attachments are visible for the page (often, for us, this is a supporting reference or the actual handout to provide), but you don't want the attachment reference to appear on the export itself. 

There is no workaround for this except to create separate pages. 

There is an attribute on the TOC for noprint, but that is also a known bug, with no plans to fix. 

Atlassian recommends using a No Print user macro; however, OnDemand customers do not have the ability to add user macros It would be helpful to provide the No Print  macro out of the box for OnDemand users.
fields.summary: Provide ability for OnDemand users to insert a no print macro
Full-fledged Confluence OnDemand importer
Confluence comments in Jira Issues
Support Mail Archiving in Confluence
Add Space Name to Updates listings
Allow users to do personalized commenting without being an OnDemand user using OpenID, Google, Facebook accounts.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36126].
  {panel}

*Confluence-only* OnDemand users are getting incorrectly redirected to a 'Down for Maintenance' page instead of the actual error message (404) when trying to access a Confluence page without the */wiki* path.

For instance, if you try to access a Confluence page and type the /wiki path in the URL incorrectly (or even don't type it), Confluence will throw the 'Down for Maintenance' error, which causes confusion because the system is not actually down or unaccessible at the moment. The error should tell the user that the page does not exist (error 404), and not an error such as 503.

For instance, the following URL will work:

_<instance>_.atlassian.net/wiki/display/DOC/Documentation

However, the followings won't:

_<instance>_.atlassian.net/*wki*/display/DOC/Documentation - 'Down for Maintenance'
_<instance>_.atlassian.net/display/DOC/Documentation - 'Down for Maintenance'
fields.summary: Confluence only users getting incorrectly redirected to 'Down for Maintenance' instead of error 404
Wrong link to the Navigation Map macro documentation

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36121].

I get an error for the macro 'excerpt include', this macro previously worked.

The preview of the excerpt include macro works, and the macro works on other spaces.

Attached are screenshots of the page and the edit of the macro with Preview working.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36119].
  {panel}

Might be related to AOD-6510. I can't embed a Google spreadsheet into my Confluence document. I get the same 404 error as quoted in AOD-6510:

An error occurred while fetching the document. Please check to make sure that the document ID is valid and tat the document has not been deleted.

Interestingly, it found the spreadsheet and let me select it. It just doesn't show. I changed the sharing on the doc to everyone in my organization.

When I paste the link in the error directly into a browser I get a 404.

Attached screenshots of the issue.

Oh, also I can click on the "edit" link at the bottom of the page (see screenshot) and it takes me directly to the Google doc in edit mode.
fields.summary: Unable to embed new Google Spreadsheet (Google Sheets) into Confluence doc
Change global Space Themes page is not accessible via UI

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This bug report is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding bug report|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36116].
  {panel}

I can configure a favicon for JIRA but not for Confluence.

Confluence does display a favicon. Maybe because I somehow uploaded one a few months ago. Or it takes the global logo as a favicon. Both don't seem like expected behavior. Should be configurable separately - or just take over the favicon I uploaded in JIRA admin.

I would consider it an bug because it's quite confusing in the web browser.

Not sure, maybe this is a duplicate of AOD-6075 but I don't really understand AOD-6075.
fields.summary: Impossible to configure a favicon in Confluence OnDemand
Learn More link in Language Configuration Leads to Page Not Found

fields.description:
When editing an already verbose (large) page in Confluence, attempting to save results in the following error message:
{code}Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page{code}

h3. Reproduction steps:
# Install Confluence
# Install Source Editor plugin (to import the attached storage format export)
# Create Blank Page
# Save Blank Page
# Edit Blank Page
# Open Source Editor
# Paste the contents of the [attached Storage Format|https://jira.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/147929/storageformat.txt]
# Attempt to save

h3. Expected behavior
The page saves

h3. Actual behavior
Confluence does not save the page, the title of the page goes blank, and the following error appears:
{code}Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request. You may need to re-submit the form or reload the page.{code}
!large_page.png|thumbnail!

h3.Workaround
Open {{confluence-install/conf/server.xml}} and add the following to your HTTP connector:

{code}
maxPostSize="10485760"
{code}

This increases the maximum POST size that Tomcat will accept - the default is 2 Megabytes. The above setting increases that to 10 Megabytes.
fields.summary: Editing Large Page Results in "Your request could not be processed because a required security token was not present in the request" error

fields.description:
When the _External user management_ option is enabled (under "USERS & SECURITY > Security Configuration"), there's no way to edit the details of a Confluence internal user.

Then option says: Delegate user management to JIRA. [More about User Management|https://docs.atlassian.com/confluence/docs-56/Disabling+the+Built-In+User+Management]
However, the internal users are not delegated to JIRA, so we should be able to edit the internal users' details.

*Steps to reproduce:*
# Go under the _Confluence Admin > USERS & SECURITY section > Security Configuration_ and click on Edit
# Check the _External user management_ option
# Go under _Users_
# Find and select the local administrator user
# Click on _Edit Details_
# There's no way to change the details like e-mail and such.

*Workaround:*
* If you have this option checked, you'll need to uncheck it in order to edit the user. You can check this option again afterwards.
fields.summary: External user management option is blocking the editing of internal users

fields.description:
h3. How to replicate
* Have a word document with the following hierarchy:
{code}
h1. Heading 1
h2.   Heading 2:
h2.   Heading 2:
{code}
(note: h1. & h2. indicates the Heading level set in MS. Word)

h3. What is expected
With the *Title conflicts* set to *Rename imported pages if page name already exists*, the outcome would be:
{code}
h1. Heading 1
h2.   Heading 2:
h2.   Heading 2:0
{code}

h3. What actually happens:
* Related to [CONF-34864|https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONF-34864], Confluence renames ":" as "_"
* A system error thrown:
{code}
Cause
com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DuplicateDataRuntimeException: A page already exists with the title Heading 2_ in the space with key TESC
    at com.atlassian.confluence.pages.DefaultPageManager.throwIfDuplicateAbstractPageTitle(DefaultPageManager.java:1132)
{code}
* Nothing is imported to Confluence
fields.summary: Import word document fails with DuplicateDataRuntimeException when two or more titles with the same heading level contains special characters
Copy formatting tool in Confluence editor
Add Ability to Promote Blank Page and Blog Post Types

fields.description:
If you add a code block macro on a page and try to paste content from another area (like notepad) the content will be pasted under the code block instead of inside it.

h4. Steps to Reproduce:
# Start a confluence 5.6.5.
# Access confluence from *IE11*.
# Create a page.
# Add a code block.
!img1.PNG|thumbnail!
(i) Note that the cursor is inside the codeblock.
# Now go to notepad and copy some content (using CTRL+C for instance).
{code}
GIT stuff:
add
commit
checkout
{code}
# Go to your confluence page and paste the content (CTRL+V).
# The content will be pasted under the code block.
!img2.PNG|thumbnail!

h4. Workaround:

Just add a character into the macro before pasting the content:
!img3.PNG|thumbnail!
Then paste the content:
!img4.PNG|thumbnail!
fields.summary: Copying and pasting content into Code Block Macro is not working in IE11
Deleted user still available for @mention in Confluence
Allows display sizes options for Roadmap Planner macro
Multimedia Macro Support HTML5 Video

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36101].
  {panel}

The current implementation of date autocomplete requires a specific date format: dd/MM/yyyy

This format is one of many standards used by Atlassian customers.

Add a configuration option to detect additional date formats in the Confluence editor. Specifically:

* yyyy/MM/dd
* MM/dd/yyyy
fields.summary: Allow configuration of autocomplete date format
Confluence 5.7 beta creates unwanted directory named after Atlassian employee

Support PostgreSQL 9.4
Copy selected pages automatically
Roadmap Planner Macro: ability to go more granular

fields.description: In Confluence 5.7, an upgrade task was added that remaps some of the attachment IDs and stores the old attachment ID as a content property against the new one. It would be nice to provide plugin developers with a library that they could use to cast attachments to content entity objects and also resolve the old attachment id property so that they can continue to compile against older versions of confluence
fields.summary: Create a compatibility library for migrated attachment IDs
Can't find a page

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36090].
  {panel}

Like is a fundamental metric: enterprise wikis accumulate lots less useful pages with time. Just think Stack Overflow without upvote counts everywhere.

Could show something like this:

- living beings (2)
-- mammals (4)
--- dogs (0)
--- cats (10k)
-- reptiles (3)
fields.summary: Show like count on the tree page hierarchy outline on left sidebar

fields.description:
I am unable to edit a spreadsheet (uploaded using the Office Excel macro) in Confluence using the WebDAV launcher.

Whenever I click the link to "Edit Document" link, nothing happens. I have also tried the following to get the issue resolved:
- Uninstall and reinstall the WebDAV launcher plugin
- Try opening in Google Chrome (not compatible)
- Configuring WebDAV manually and associating the xlsx extension with the Excel binary. When I do this, Excel does open, but it does not open the file for editing
fields.summary: WebDAV Plugin does not work with Firefox and MacOS

fields.description:
The title text of the favourites icon (e.g. at _/users/viewmyfavourites.action_) is unescaped and therefore broken for German and Spanish localisation.

Correct title in English (also correct in French and Japanese):
!fav-icon-title-en.png|thumbnail!

*Problem*
Unescaped/broken in German:
!fav-icon-title-de.png|thumbnail!

Unescaped/broken in Spanish:
!fav-icon-title-es.png|thumbnail!

*Solution*
Properly escape the title in German an Spanish localisation.
fields.summary: Title of Favourites Icon is broken in German and Spanish

fields.description:
We have discovered and fixed a vulnerability in our fork of WebWork. Attackers can use this vulnerability to execute Java code of their choice on systems that use this framework. The attacker needs to have an account and be able to access the Confluence web interface.

All versions of Confluence up to and including 5.6 are affected by this vulnerability.

The vulnerability has been fixed in releases 5.5.7 and 5.6.6.

For additional details see the full advisory.
fields.summary: OGNL Double Evaluation Vulnerability

fields.description:
Atlassian Confluence 5.3.4 for CA Wiki pages. 

We use Wiki for our knowledge transfer in my group. I have found an annoying problem when editing a Wiki page - it seems to ignore the period. That is, if I am editing a Wiki page, hit the end of a sentence and type a period '.' - it does not show up (and cursor does not progress one space). 

If I notice it, I can type a few spaces with the space bar, then back up using the arrow keys (NOT the backspace), so the blanks are still there, and then type the period with no problem. Once I have done that, the periods work correctly from that point on, unless I get ahead of the entered blanks or not. 

Thanks
fields.summary: In edit, periods are not accepted

fields.description: There is a specific PPT template my company uses for EVERY project. When I use the PPT Macro, the Header Text in PPT render as backwards. On one confluence page, I downloaded the file and opened it in PowerPoint. I saved the file as a .PPT instead of PPTX and also used the reduce the file size feature. When I attached that version of the file to the confluence page. The Headings showed properly. However, When I do the same for a different Project, it still renders the Header Text in PPT backwards. Due to the sensitivity of the info contained in these documents, I had to "X" out certain info in the PPT files and mark over the info from the screenshots taken from Confluence.
fields.summary: Heading Text in PPT render as backwards

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *Confluence Server*. Using *Confluence Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/CONFCLOUD-36075].
  {panel}

A customizable "*Empty trash*" mechanism which would automatically purge from each space trash all deleted files whose deletion is dated before a customizable time range value. The frequence of the purge could also be customizable.

The function would be customized through the following interfaces:
* a site admin interface where site-wide defaults are defined (with "Never purge" as a possible choice)
* a space admin interface where site-wide defaults can be overridden by local values

Advantages of regularly purging deleted pages through such a mechanism would include:
* releasing unneeded data and database space
* preventing side effects and problems, such as the one documented in [Page cannot be moved between spaces due to existing duplicate in trash|https://confluence.atlassian.com/x/r4QtKQ]
* eliminating the time-consuming (and needless) chore for admins to manually sort and purge deleted files
* by-passing a limitation of the present "Trash" listing, where there is no "Deleted on" column on which a selective purge could be based
fields.summary: Empty space trash automatically.

fields.description:
Inserting PDF Macros preview of 30 PDFs or more causing Constant High CPU Usage in client PC.

*Steps to replicate*
# Use a system resources monitor
# Create a Confluence page
# Drag and drop 30 PDFs or more (sample files - [link|https://support.atlassian.com/secure/attachment/1001442/WIKI_pdfs.zip] restricted to Reporters and Developers)
# Save page
# Observe the constant high CPU usages

*Observation*
- Minimizing the browser where the page is opened lower down the CPU usage
- The high CPU usage is constant even after the PDF Macros are rendered successfully in one page and the browser is left open without any activities (no clicking macros/link, no scrolling up/down the page) from the user
fields.summary: Numerous PDF Macros Causing Constant High CPU Usage

fields.description:
Debian GNU/Linux 7.7 (wheezy)
Launched the installer with sudo

{quote}
Configure which ports Confluence will use.
Confluence requires two TCP ports that are not being used by any other
applications on this machine. The HTTP port is where you will access
Confluence through your browser. The Control port is used to Startup and
Shutdown Confluence.
Use default ports (HTTP: 8090, Control: 8000) - Recommended [1, Enter], Set custom value for HTTP and Control ports [2]
2
HTTP Port Number
[8090]
51000
Control Port Number
[8000]
51001
{quote}

I changed the port in custom installation but the change was not reflected in server.xml. Confluence was run on default ports despite at the end of the installation it says
{quote}
Your installation of Confluence 5.6.5 is now ready and can be accessed via
your browser.
Confluence 5.6.5 can be accessed at http://localhost:51000
Finishing installation ...
{quote}
fields.summary: Confluence Server - Linux Installer (64 bit) ignores port configuration

fields.description:
Setting up e.g. a personal space and giving only the owner full access, anonymous access denied, some people (administrators?) still have access (can view, change permission and add comments). This is regardless of space or site restriction.

We are using the build-in security systems shared with JIRA v6.0.1.

This is a big issue for us, since confidential data has been made available to non eligible personal and we have hundreds of people all over the world using our setup which incl. several people with administrator rights.
fields.summary: Administrator role has access to restricted pages
